title: Hard Hearted Hannah (The Vamp of Savannah)
text:
”Hard Hearted Hannah, the Vamp of Savannah” is a popular song with words by <a href="Jack%20Yellen">Jack Yellen</a>, Bob Bigelow, and Charles Bates, and music by <a href="Milton%20Ager">Milton Ager</a>. The song was published in June 1924 by Ager, Yellen & Bornstein, Inc., New York.
“Hard Hearted Hannah” tells in humorous fashion the story of a sadistic "vamp" or <a href="femme%20fatale">femme fatale</a> from <a href="Savannah%2C%20Georgia">Savannah, Georgia</a>.
Popularized by vocalist <a href="Margaret%20Young">Margaret Young</a>, it also had early recordings by vocalists <a href="Lucille%20Hegamin">Lucille Hegamin</a> and <a href="Dolly%20Kay">Dolly Kay</a>, <a href="Vernon%20Dalhart">Vernon Dalhart</a> in 1924, <a href="Herb%20Wiedoeft">Herb Wiedoeft</a>'s band (1924) and by <a href="Paul%20Whiteman%20and%20His%20Orchestra">Paul Whiteman and His Orchestra</a>. A quarter century later <a href="Peggy%20Lee">Peggy Lee</a> revived "Hannah" very successfully for <a href="Capitol%20Records">Capitol Records</a>, and the <a href="Ray%20Charles%20Singers">Ray Charles Singers</a> made a hit version for <a href="Decca%20Records">Decca</a>.
The song has been recorded numerous times by such performers as <a href="Patti%20Austin">Patti Austin</a>, <a href="Belle%20Baker">Belle Baker</a>, <a href="Jim%20Croce">Jim Croce</a>, <a href="Bobby%20Darin">Bobby Darin</a>, <a href="Cliff%20Edwards">Cliff "Ukulele Ike" Edwards</a>, <a href="Ella%20Fitzgerald">Ella Fitzgerald</a>, <a href="Sue%20Keller">Sue Keller</a>, <a href="Stacey%20Kent">Stacey Kent</a>, <a href="Julie%20London">Julie London</a>, <a href="Turk%20Murphy">Turk Murphy</a>, <a href="The%20Nitty%20Gritty%20Dirt%20Band">The Nitty Gritty Dirt Band</a>, <a href="Nancy%20Sinatra">Nancy Sinatra</a>, <a href="Kay%20Starr">Kay Starr</a>, <a href="Pat%20Suzuki">Pat Suzuki</a>, <a href="The%20Temperance%20Seven">The Temperance Seven</a>, <a href="Toni%20Tennille">Toni Tennille</a>, <a href="Mary%20Testa">Mary Testa</a>, <a href="Sophie%20Tucker">Sophie Tucker</a>, <a href="Margaret%20Whiting">Margaret Whiting</a> and <a href="Sun%20Ra">Sun Ra</a>.
Memorable television or film performances of the song include those by <a href="Carol%20Burnett">Carol Burnett</a>, <a href="Peggy%20Lee">Peggy Lee</a>, <a href="Dorothy%20Loudon">Dorothy Loudon</a>, <a href="Ella%20Fitzgerald">Ella Fitzgerald</a> (on "<a href="Pete%20Kelly%27s%20Blues%20%28film%29">Pete Kelly's Blues</a>"), and <a href="Beatrice%20Arthur">Beatrice Arthur</a> on "<a href="Maude%20%28TV%20series%29">Maude</a>" and "<a href="The%20Golden%20Girls">The Golden Girls</a>". The song was performed by vampire Bill Compton (played by <a href="Stephen%20Moyer">Stephen Moyer</a>) in the sixth episode of the second season of the <a href="HBO">HBO</a> show <a href="True%20Blood">True Blood</a>, also called "Hard-Hearted Hannah"; Dolly Kay's recording of the song plays over the final credits.
In season 1 of <a href="American%20Idol">American Idol</a>, contestant <a href="Nikki%20McKibbin">Nikki McKibbin</a> sang this song in the finals where she ended up in the Bottom 3.
